result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mathew Alvarez

Case called at 9:35 a.m.
Intern Abigail Kincheloe in court for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Michael M. Hayes appeared by video for Mathew Alvarez.   
Defendant Mathew Alvarez appeared by video. 
Court grants defense motion to suspend proceedings.
Court sets a hearing date in March - 2023.
Hearing scheduled for March 13, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on March 13, 2023 at 09:30 am.
dated 10-18-2022 from Atty. Michael Hayes, with correction/clarification to Motion to Suspend, with attached article
Motion to Suspend Proceedings for 12-01-2022 Surgery and Recovery filed by Atty. Michael Hayes

10:13 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Defendant Mathew Alvarez appeared by video.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes appeared by video for Mathew Alvarez. 
Matter called for motion to modify bail in this matter. 
Atty Hayes makes a statement on the record as to modification of bail. 
State objects to bail modification. 
Court modifies bail and removes WCS monitoring. (Level 1 WCS)
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Second Motion to Terminate Weekly WCS Reporting, with attachments;  filed by Atty. Michael Hayes;  
  **Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 08-08-022:  to be addressed at next hearing on 08-08-2022.
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:16 AM Defendant Mathew Alvarez in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for the Defense's Motion to Strike Prior Conviction for Purposes of Sentence Enhancement.

Attorney Hayes states that there is a stipulation for admission into evidence the affidavit of Theresa A. McCafferty, Clerk of Court, 6th Circuit District Division, Concord, NH without her testimony (Exhibit/Doc. 23) & Loudon Police Department Arrest Report (Exhibit 3/Doc. 24).  The Court receives Defendant's Exhibit 2 (Doc. 23) & Exhibit 3 (Doc. 24).
The Defendant is sworn in and testifies on direct by attorney Hayes.
Attorney Hays requests to admit Defendant's Exhibit 1 (Doc. 22) in to evidence.  No objection from attorney Szczupakiewicz.  The Court receives Defendant's Exhibit 1 (Doc. 22).
Cross examination by DDA Szczupakiewicz.
Redirect by attorney Hayes.
The witness is excused.
Attorney Hayes requests the Court takes judicial notice of the CCAP record of Milwaukee case 05FA5849.  No objection from DDA Szczupakiewicz. The Court does take judicial notice. 
The Defense rests.
The State rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

Attorney Hayes presents closing arguments and requests to strike prior conviction and amend the charge to an OWI 3rd.
DDA Szczupakiewicz presents closing arguments and requests the Court to deny the motion.
Attorney Hayes places counter arguments. 
The Court questions the parties.
Attorney Hayes presents his last arguments.
DDA Szczupakiewicz presents his last arguments.

The Court recesses at 12:15 PM for the Trial Court to review its decision.
The Court recalls the matter at 12:21 PM with the same appearances.

The Court places its findings on the record.
The Court denies the Defense's Motion to Strike Prior Conviction for Purposes of Sentence Enhancement.
The Court will draft an order.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance report dated 06-16-2022 received and filed.
dated 06-14-2022 from Attorney Michael Hayes, re: stipulation to admission into evidence the affidavit of Theresa McCafferty without her testimony
dated 06-03-2022 from Attorney Michael Hayes, indicating the defendant will not request action on the Huber bailee motion at the 06-17-2022 hearing.

09:14 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mathew Alvarez in court by zoom video with attorney Michael M. Hayes by zoom video.  Defense has filed a Motion to Strike Prior Conviction (New Hampshire Conviction).  Attorney Hayes presents statements to the Court in regards to the motions filed.  The Court will address the Motion to Strike on June 17, 2022.  Parties are to appear in person for the next date which remains as set for June 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance report dated 06-02-2022 received and filed.
Exhibits 1, 2 & 3 for Motion to Strike Prior Conviction for Purposes of Sentence Enhancement.
Motion to Strike Prior Conviction for Purposes of Sentence Enhancement, filed by Attorney Hayes.
Motion hearing on June 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
